title: Quarter of the year
body: Given a month as an integer from 1 to 12, return to which quarter of the year it belongs as an integer number.

title: Multiples of 3 or 5
body:
If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23.

Finish the solution so that it returns the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below the number passed in. Additionally, if the number is negative, return 0 (for languages that do have them).

Note: If the number is a multiple of both 3 and 5, only count it once.

title: Vowel Count
body:
Return the number (count) of vowels in the given string.

We will consider a, e, i, o, u as vowels for this Kata (but not y).

The input string will only consist of lower case letters and/or spaces.

title: Even or Odd
body: Create a function that takes an integer as an argument and returns "Even" for even numbers or "Odd" for odd numbers.

title: Find the odd int
body:
Given an array of integers, find the one that appears an odd number of times.

There will always be only one integer that appears an odd number of times.

title: Square Every Digit
body:
Welcome. In this kata, you are asked to square every digit of a number and concatenate them.

For example, if we run 9119 through the function, 811181 will come out, because 92 is 81 and 12 is 1.
